snippet: The Doomsday Book is a collection of legal opinions on the Fed’s authority to fight financial crises. And that’s all the New York Fed has to say.
abstract: Doomsday Book, collection of legal opinions on Federal Reserve's authority to fight financial crises, has popped into public view because investors suing government over terms of American International Group bailout say memos inside show Fed broke its own rules; Federal Reserve Bank of New York, which compiles book, is asking judge to keep contents confidential during trial.
lead_paragraph: The Doomsday Book is a collection of legal opinions on the Fed’s authority to fight financial crises. And that’s all the New York Fed has to say.

headline.main: Fed Is Silent on Doomsday Book, a Blueprint for Fighting Crises
headline.print_headline: Fed Is Silent on Blueprint Used to Fight A.I.G. Crisis

keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
keywords.name: organizations
